metadata.title: NIST Cybersecurity Framework 2.0
metadata.description: NIST CSF 2.0 taxonomy with Functions, Categories, and Subcategories

functions.title: Govern
functions.description: Establish and monitor the organization's cybersecurity risk management strategy, expectations, and policy framework.

categories.title: Organizational Context
categories.description: The organization's mission, objectives, stakeholders, and activities are understood and used to inform cybersecurity risk management decisions.

subcategories.title: Mission and Business Objectives
subcategories.description: The organizational mission and business objectives are defined and communicated.

subcategories.title: Internal and External Stakeholders
subcategories.description: Internal and external stakeholders are identified and their cybersecurity expectations understood.

subcategories.title: Legal, Regulatory, and Contractual Requirements
subcategories.description: Legal, regulatory, and contractual requirements regarding cybersecurity are identified and managed.

categories.title: Risk Management Strategy
categories.description: The organization's priorities, constraints, risk tolerances, and assumptions are established and used to support operational risk decisions.

subcategories.title: Risk Management Process
subcategories.description: A risk management process is established and managed.

subcategories.title: Risk Tolerance
subcategories.description: Risk tolerance is identified and clearly expressed.

subcategories.title: Determination of Risk Tolerance
subcategories.description: The organization's determination of risk tolerance is informed by its role in critical infrastructure and sector-specific risk analysis.

functions.title: Identify
functions.description: Develop an organizational understanding to manage cybersecurity risk to systems, people, assets, data, and capabilities.

categories.title: Asset Management
categories.description: Assets are identified and managed consistent with their relative importance to organizational objectives and the organization's risk strategy.

subcategories.title: Asset Inventory
subcategories.description: Assets are cataloged and managed throughout the asset lifecycle.

subcategories.title: Asset Classification
subcategories.description: Assets are classified based on business functions and value.

subcategories.title: Organizational Communication
subcategories.description: Organizational communication and data flows are mapped.

subcategories.title: External Information Systems
subcategories.description: External information systems are cataloged.

categories.title: Risk Assessment
categories.description: The organization understands the cybersecurity risk to organizational operations, assets, and individuals.

subcategories.title: Asset Vulnerabilities
subcategories.description: Asset vulnerabilities are identified and documented.

subcategories.title: Threat Intelligence
subcategories.description: Threat intelligence is received from information sharing forums and sources.

subcategories.title: Threat and Vulnerability Information
subcategories.description: Threats, both internal and external, are identified and documented.

functions.title: Protect
functions.description: Develop and implement appropriate safeguards to ensure delivery of critical infrastructure services.

categories.title: Identity Management and Access Control
categories.description: Access to physical and logical assets and associated facilities is limited to authorized users, processes, and devices.

subcategories.title: Identity Management
subcategories.description: Identities and credentials are issued, managed, verified, revoked, and audited for authorized devices, users and processes.

subcategories.title: Physical Access Control
subcategories.description: Physical access to assets is managed and protected.

subcategories.title: Remote Access
subcategories.description: Remote access is managed.

subcategories.title: Access Permissions
subcategories.description: Access permissions and authorizations are managed, incorporating the principles of least privilege and separation of duties.

categories.title: Data Security
categories.description: Information and records are managed consistent with the organization's risk strategy to protect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of information.

subcategories.title: Data-at-rest
subcategories.description: Data-at-rest is protected.

subcategories.title: Data-in-transit
subcategories.description: Data-in-transit is protected.

subcategories.title: Assets and Systems Resilience
subcategories.description: Assets are formally managed throughout removal, transfers, and disposition.

functions.title: Detect
functions.description: Develop and implement appropriate activities to identify the occurrence of a cybersecurity event.

categories.title: Anomalies and Events
categories.description: Anomalous activity is detected and the potential impact of events is understood.

subcategories.title: Network Monitoring
subcategories.description: A baseline of network operations and expected data flows is established and managed.

subcategories.title: Event Analysis
subcategories.description: Detected events are analyzed to understand attack targets and methods.

subcategories.title: Event Data Aggregation
subcategories.description: Event data are collected and correlated from multiple sources and sensors.

categories.title: Security Continuous Monitoring
categories.description: The information system and assets are monitored to identify cybersecurity events and verify the effectiveness of protective measures.

subcategories.title: Network Monitoring
subcategories.description: The network is monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events.

subcategories.title: Physical Environment Monitoring
subcategories.description: The physical environment is monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events.

subcategories.title: Personnel Activity Monitoring
subcategories.description: Personnel activity is monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events.

functions.title: Respond
functions.description: Develop and implement appropriate activities to take action regarding a detected cybersecurity incident.

categories.title: Response Planning
categories.description: Response processes and procedures are executed and maintained to ensure response to detected cybersecurity incidents.

subcategories.title: Response Plan
subcategories.description: Response plan is executed during or after an incident.

subcategories.title: Personnel Response
subcategories.description: Personnel know their roles and order of operations when a response is needed.

subcategories.title: Information Sharing
subcategories.description: Information is shared consistent with response plans.

categories.title: Communications
categories.description: Response activities are coordinated with internal and external stakeholders.

subcategories.title: Personnel Communications
subcategories.description: Personnel know their roles and order of operations when a response is needed.

subcategories.title: Internal Communications
subcategories.description: Events are reported consistent with established criteria.

subcategories.title: External Communications
subcategories.description: Information is shared consistent with response plans.

functions.title: Recover
functions.description: Develop and implement appropriate activities to maintain plans for resilience and to restore any capabilities or services that were impaired due to a cybersecurity incident.

categories.title: Recovery Planning
categories.description: Recovery processes and procedures are executed and maintained to ensure restoration of systems or assets affected by cybersecurity incidents.

subcategories.title: Recovery Plan
subcategories.description: Recovery plan is executed during or after a cybersecurity incident.

subcategories.title: Recovery Plan Testing
subcategories.description: Recovery plans incorporate lessons learned.

subcategories.title: Recovery Plan Communication
subcategories.description: Recovery planning and processes are communicated to internal and external stakeholders.

categories.title: Improvements
categories.description: Recovery planning and processes are improved by incorporating lessons learned into future activities.

subcategories.title: Recovery Lessons Learned
subcategories.description: Recovery plans incorporate lessons learned.

subcategories.title: Recovery Strategy Updates
subcategories.description: Recovery strategies are updated.
